segments.text: As I look at the scene, I see that woman in her dress, casually drying the dishes, seemingly content.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, I can’t help but be surprised at how she’s entirely unaware of the water flooding the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting larger, and I feel a creeping sense of dread in the back of my mind.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is fiercely concentrated on getting those cookies; he looks like a little bandit.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the girl is just standing there, her hand raised, completely trusting him to share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The danger of him falling off that stool fills me with a rush of anger; it’s reckless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel as if I’m witnessing a silent disaster brewing, with the woman blissfully ignorant.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window makes the scene almost beautiful, despite the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could freeze time, just for a moment, to warn them of the impending trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like a picture of perfect domesticity married with the threat of a huge mess.
segments.speaker: PAR
